alert.note: Alert for Hale (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 30 at 4:06PM CDT until June 30 at 5:15PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Texas, including the following counties, Hale and Lamb. * WHEN...Until 500 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 406 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated very heavy rain due to slow-moving thunderstorms. The West Texas Mesonet site at Plainview recorded 0.73 inches of rain in just 20 minutes. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 2 inches are expected over the area, especially over southeastern Lamb County. A Flash Flood Warning has been issued for southeastern portions of Lamb County where the heaviest rain continues. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Plainview, Hale Center, Cotton Center, Spade and Seth Ward. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
